alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD AND SOUTHWESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 254 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Reynoldsburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Gahanna, Pickerington, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Johnstown, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Harbor Hills, Granville South, Beechwood Trails, Summit Station, Thornport, Fairfield Beach, Etna and New Albany. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
